page.title: 17EAST COKER'S HISTORY
page.content: Although remains of{Roman}buildings have been excavated in the area,the {oldest building}still standing is{All {Saint's Church in Sutton Bingham.}This dates from 1111A.D.with major alterations from 1300 A.D.{Wall {paintings}from this layer date may still be seen,but it is thought that there were earlier colour designs on the west wall of the chancel.The church has rounded{Norman arches}as well as later pointed windows. Close by on the south side is{Sutton {Bingham Manor}which is one of several {Tudor}buildings in the area. { Hymerford House}in East Coker dates from Medieval times.Its most famous occupant was{William Dampier,}born there in 1651,who later explored parts of the Pacific Ocean,giving his name to a number of geographical features in Indonesia and Australia.
